intro: Pentas lanceolata, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, bright red or orange flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped, hence the species name, and are arranged oppositely along the stems. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is known to thrive in warm, sunny climates. It is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
